title: Stringer
content:
Stringers are one of the main weapon classes in the Splatoon series.

Stringers are bow and arrow-like charging weapons that can fire spreads of arcing ink projectiles in horizontal or vertical configurations.

Stringers were first introduced in Splatoon 3.

Stringers have similarities to both charging weapon classes introduced before them. They possess increased range when charged with , while also increasing damage (with the potential for a one-hit splat) like chargers, but they also possess two levels of charge akin to splatlings.

When charging, range increases proportionally to the amount of charge, allowing the stringer user to more finely control where their arcing shots may land. However, damage is usually immediately increased by a flat amount when the first charging circle is filled, meaning stringers are not as beholden as chargers to a full charge for maximum lethality.

Stringers fire in a horizontal spread when grounded, but a user may additionally choose to fire vertically at any time by jumping with  (or any other means of entering a midair state). Depending on charge level, this may narrow the horizontal spread of ink considerably, but can also increase lethality when targeting enemies.

Note: The series are arranged by their respective order in the weapon select screen with the Main filter.

The following stringer(s) are only available outside of battles as part of other modes:

Spawner pose:

- All styles: Stands in a crouched pose with their weapon angled down and their right hand readied.

Victory:

- Flip Out: Jumping into the air while shooting the weapon downwards twice, then lands kneeling and pulls its string back while aiming into the distance.

- Reppin' Inkopolis: Twirls the weapon around before pulling the string back and aiming into the distance while standing. (Added in version 7.0.0. Versions prior used the same animation as Flip Out.)

- The Square Show-Off: Throws the weapon in the air, spins with it after catching it, and pulling the string back while kneeling with their back turned the camera.

- Stringers have a currently unused feature that traces the path that their projectiles will take while they charge.

- As of Version 10.0.0, the stringer class is tied with the Splatana and Brush classes for having the least number of weapon sets in it, with only eight.

- Despite stringers' shots falling, the shots do not lose damage as they fall. The only other main weapons to have this trait are the Bloblobber, Explosher, and Tenta Brella families.

- The internal ordering of stringer weapon IDs is different from all other weapon classes.
Following the first one or two digits, which identify a weapon's class, all other weapon classes have a weapon internally listed as being the "0"th main weapon of that type. It is then followed by another number to indicate which kit loadout of the weapon it is. Curiously, the stringer class skips the expected value 7000 and begins with the Tri-Stringer as weapon ID 7010, which would usually be reserved for the second weapon in the class.
